senses.de: What people think of someone or something
senses.ex: He has a reputation for being very reliable.

Tips.title: Subjectivity
Tips.description: Reputation can be subjective, based on individual opinions rather than facts.
Tips.example: Despite the rumors, her reputation among her friends remained positive.

Tips.title: Cultural Variation
Tips.description: Different cultures may value certain traits differently, affecting reputation.
Tips.example: His reputation for punctuality improved after he moved to Japan.

Tips.title: Temporal Change
Tips.description: Reputation can change over time with new actions or information.
Tips.example: The chef's reputation improved after the restaurant won an award.

senses.de: The opinion that people have about what someone or something is like, based on what has happened in the past
senses.ex: The organization has a reputation for professionalism in its approach.

Tips.title: Professional Context
Tips.description: In business, reputation is crucial and can impact career opportunities.
Tips.example: The firm's reputation for excellence attracted top-tier clients.

Tips.title: Collective Reputation
Tips.description: Organizations, like individuals, have reputations that affect public trust.
Tips.example: The charity's good reputation helped increase donations.

Tips.title: Long-term Effects
Tips.description: A strong reputation, once established, can benefit someone for a long time.
Tips.example: His reputation as a negotiator opened many doors in his career.

Character.wordDefinition:
Character refers to a person's true nature, values, and behavior when no one is watching. It is who they really are as a person.

Character matters in personal relationships, while reputation matters in public perception, such as in career or social situations.

It is important to have a good character because it influences one's reputation and how others perceive them.

Credibility.wordDefinition:
Credibility refers to how believable or trustworthy something or someone is. For example, if a news source has a history of reporting accurate information, they have good credibility.

If someone has been caught lying or exaggerating in the past, their credibility may be questioned.

Both credibility and reputation are important in different ways. Credibility is necessary for establishing trust and being considered a reliable source or person.

Esteem.wordDefinition:
Esteem refers to the way you feel about yourself, and how others respect and value you. It's about the value you place on yourself, and the opinions you have about your own worth.

Esteem is applicable in personal growth, and self-confidence while reputation is applicable in public perception and social standing.

Esteem is about how you see yourself, while reputation is about how others see you.

Fame.wordDefinition:
Fame is the state of being widely known or recognized for one's achievements, actions, or personality.

Fame can be positive or negative, depending on the individual's actions and public perception.

Fame is about being known while reputation is about the impression people have of you. Fame is usually applied more to public figures and celebrities, while reputation can apply to anyone.

Honour.wordDefinition:
Honour refers to a person's inner sense of moral and ethical values, principles, and actions. It is the quality of being honest, fair, and trustworthy.

Honour is applicable in personal contexts such as how an individual behaves, treats others, and conducts themselves in their personal and professional life.

Honour is about an individual's personal values, while reputation is about how others perceive and judge them.

Image.wordDefinition:
Image refers to the visual representation of a person or organization, whereas reputation refers to what people think or say about that person or organization based on their actions or behavior.

For example, a company might have a sleek and modern logo, which is part of its image.

Similarly, a celebrity might have a glamorous image due to their appearance and social media presence, but a negative reputation due to scandals or controversy.

Image is how something looks on the surface, while reputation is what people actually think or feel about it based on its actions and behavior.

Prestige.wordDefinition:
Prestige refers to the level of respect and admiration that a person, place, or thing has earned through their accomplishments, awards or associations.

So, while prestige is earned through success and achievement, reputation is earned or lost through the way one conducts themselves, day-in and day-out.

A celebrity with high prestige might be known for his/her award-winning performances, business empire or philanthropic work, but their reputation may depend on how they handle controversy, media attention, or public scrutiny.

Stand.wordDefinition:
Stand refers to a person's position or viewpoint on a specific issue or situation. It is the stance that they take on something.

For example, a person may take a stand against animal cruelty or stand up for their beliefs even when it is difficult to do so.

Reputation refers to how others view a person or company based on their past actions, while stand refers to a person's viewpoint or position on a specific issue.

quotes.Text: I may have made my reputation as a general in the Army, and I'm very proud of that. But I've always felt that I was more than one-dimensional. I'd like to think I'm a caring human being.
quotes.Title: American General
quotes.Name: Norman Schwarzkopf

quotes.Text: I remember, when I was a young guy in the SEAL teams, I was very afraid of making mistakes and looking stupid or doing dumb things and getting a bad reputation.
quotes.Title: American
quotes.Name: Jocko Willink

quotes.Text: Character is like a tree and reputation like a shadow. The shadow is what we think of it; the tree is the real thing.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.Text: The most important thing for a young man is to establish a credit... a reputation, character.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: John D. Rockefeller

quotes.Text: Reputation is what men and women think of us; character is what God and angels know of us.
quotes.Title: English Activist
quotes.Name: Thomas Paine

quotes.Text: Many a man's reputation would not know his character if they met on the street.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.Text: If I take care of my character, my reputation will take care of me.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: Dwight L. Moody

quotes.Text: Be more concerned with your character than your reputation.
quotes.Title: American Coach
quotes.Name: John Wooden

quotes.Text: Build your reputation by helping other people build theirs.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Anthony J. D'Angelo

quotes.Text: Along with success comes a reputation for wisdom.
quotes.Title: Greek Poet
quotes.Name: Euripides
